title: Large Language Models for Extrapolative Modeling of Manufacturing Processes
authors: K N Khanghah, A Patel, R Malhotra, H Xu
abstract: This paper presents a novel LLM-based framework that combines literature-driven knowledge extraction with minimal experimental data to build highly extrapolative models, outperforming the conventional machine learning approach.

title: Real-Time Recovery From Cyberattacks on Manufacturing Processes
authors: B Mangrolia, J Cleeman, A Patel, A Jackson, R Malhotra
abstract: This paper presents and evaluates an AI-based framework for FFF that enables real-time recovery from inter-road defects caused by cyberattacks on both internal and external process parameters, including scenarios beyond the system's training.

title: Continuing minimal-defect production under material integrity cyberattacks
authors: B Mangrolia, J Cleeman, A Patel, S Wei, C Shao, H Xu, R Malhotra
abstract: This paper proposes a novel AI-based framework for real-time recovery from defects caused by cyberattacks on manufacturing processes.

title: Toolpath Synthesis and Mechanical Properties in Multiplexed Fused Filament Fabrication
authors: J Cleeman, A Jackson, A Patel, R Malhotra
conference: ASME International Manufacturing Science and Engineering Conference
abstract: This paper introduces an automated toolpath synthesis approach for MF3, focusing on the thermal and mechanical analysis of section junctions to improve process planning and mechanical performance.

title: Throughput scaling and thermomechanical behaviour in multiplexed fused filament fabrication
authors: R Malhotra, J Cleeman, A Jackson, A Patel, A Pelegri
abstract: This paper highlights the novel ability of MF3 to dramatically scale throughput by addressing part size, infill density, and extruder spacing effects, along with a new thermal model that explains how the atypical temperature history enhances mechanical properties.
